alert.note: Alert for Appomattox; Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:27AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Appomattox and Buckingham Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 122 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over western Buckingham County, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph. Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may pond on roads. Locations impacted include... Buckingham... Dillwyn... Bent Creek... Toga... Sheppards... Andersonville... and Wingina. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A torrential downpour of rain is possible with this storm which may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Also expect occasional cloud to ground lightning. Keep in mind that lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle until the storm has passed.
